summary: This bill, the "Preventing Ranked Choice Corruption Act," aims to prohibit the use of ranked-choice voting in elections for federal office. It amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to include a provision specifically forbidding states from using this voting method. The bill also includes conforming and clerical amendments related to existing enforcement and table of contents. The effective date of the act and its amendments would be for elections held in 2026 and later.
